About the team:

Financial Risk Management (FRM) oversees all financial market and credit risks that arise throughout Swiss Re Group, from its core reinsurance businesses and the related investment and asset-liability matching activities. Within FRM, the Valuation Risk Management (VRM) is a global team responsible for identifying, monitoring, and reporting the risks to the valuations in the firm's asset portfolio. One of the team's main responsibilities is to perform the independent price verification (IPV) process to ensure that valuations reflected in financial statements are in line with accounting requirements and industry best practice.

Valuations assigned to financial instruments play a key role in understanding our portfolio and enabling appropriate decisions to be made. Valuations feed into our accounts, are at the core of P/L, determine the calibration of models, and form a key part of risk assessment. Inaccurate valuations distort the decision making process, and so it is clear that controls ensuring appropriate valuations are an essential part of the firm's operations. To ensure the firm is utilizing appropriate valuations, Swiss Re has developed an IPV process that formally assesses the quality of our valuations and acts to correct any issues.
